lines.text: I'll be dead long before you were born and I'll be dead long before you'll be dead.
[Space Ghost has received a phone call from his wife, Björk]
Uh, hey, honey, how are you?
Do you like sulfur?
Sulfur? Sulfur's my favorite food, honey, you know that. Is that why you called me?
Yeah.
Oh, great.
Can I sing in Icelandic?
Uh, not now, honey, please, I'm right in the middle of, a, um... giant space war.
I... I enjoy talking to you.
Uh, yes you do, but like I said, this, uh, space war, what can I do?
[pause]
...aliens.
Yeah?
Yeah, so, you have to go now.
Okay.
Okay, so... I'll talk to you when there's... peace. In space.
I have a giant brain that is able to reduce any complex machine into a simple yes or no answer.
My favorite episode of The Golden Girls is the one where they all took contaminated Geritol and died.
That was never an episode!
Well, it should have been.
Zorak, where's your nephew?
Who? Oh, um, I devoured him.
That's barbaric!
[hungrily]
Is there any left?
Who do you think you are?
I think the universe knows who I am, Space Ghost.
Then who do you think the universe knows I am, Denis?
Space Ghost. And I'm Denis Leary, master of the universe.
Master? I know one or two guys who might disagree with you... master!
Like who?
Yoda.
Okay, who else on the list?
[beat]
Star Wars.
Moltar, flush the lake.
We don't have a lake.
Good work.
I am the Lone Locust of the apocalypse. Think of me when you look to the night sky.
Tell me, Chuck, ever thought of starring in a sequel to The Ten Commandments?
No.
Uh, I don't think so.
Not a sequel man, eh?
No.
What other commandments are we going to write?
Thou that smelled it thine own self dealt it.

[laughs]
Thou that smelled it thine own self dealt it.

[fake laugh]
Jerk.
Yeah, well...
Thou shalt not... hesitate.
I'm kind of committed to the first ten.
Thou shalt not be committed to old commandments!
Zorak, one more commandment out of you, and thou shalt be blasted!
Thou shalt not mess with Zorak, or thou shalt have to mess with me!
All right, everybody, just calm down!
Thou shalt not calm down!
I hesitate...
Thou shalt not hesitate!
[watching 60s cartoon of himself]
Those stupid kids, why did I even bother?
[wearing large wig]
What? This is my natural head of hair.
[Space Ghost and Moltar are holding a dinner murder mystery]
Now, what about these beans?
Those must've fallen out of my hair.
[pause]
Well, you're just making all this (bleep) up!
[pause]
Oh, what, you're the only one that gets to make (bleep) up?
[pause]
Those are part of the dinner.
No they're not. They're part of the plot.
They were on the menu.
Murder is on the menu.
It's shampoo for your hair, and your brain.
Hey! You took my soul!
You dance like a woman.
I dance like a woman... if she were a man!
Well... ya got me there.
I'll spank you smartly with my spank ray.
[Space Ghost's grandfather takes over hosting]
You're shooting blanks, Grandpa!

Shut your pie hole, Blip! Why, twenty years ago I woulda put your head in a half nelson, twisted it around, saying each letter of the alphabet on every turn, and then when I reached the first letter of my true love's name (that would be the lovely Elizabeth), I would yank your head clean off and roll it down the pike like a bowling ball!

[wide-eyed]
Okay.
I could plead the Fifth.
If you could count that high.
I got a friend coming by in about five minutes, so, uh... I gotta escape.
What are you all gonna do?
I think we're gonna smash light bulbs out by the dumpster.
Space Ghost, I'm picking up four unidentified heat sources on my monitor screen.
Well, they're probably just creatures, Moltar. Space creatures.
They just violated our airspace.
[pause]
Bring me my monocle. I want to look rich.
Who else is going to be on the show?
Your guts.
Oh.
And we're clear.
Well, that wasn't very good.
I'm sorry.
Oh, no, it's all right, really. You're just not very good.
Did you create the show?
By create, you mean write, produce, direct and star in?
Yeah.
Then, yes. I created it... for you.
[whispering]
For Christmas!
In my wildest fantasies, I never imagined that I would really be invited to be on your show.
Mmmmmmmm... WILD fantasies.
You have a... I don't know, something about you.
Would you like to have some of my... sex? With me?
No one sleeps with my grandmother!
[pause]
Right?
Right!
[in the background]
From now on.
Wow, Denis Leary! I've seen all your movies.
Thank you, thank you.
I didn't think they were very good.
[beat]
What'd you think?
Oh boy, the Shatner's really hit the fan now. I'm up Dawson's Creek without a paddle.
Vengence is the refuge of the weak.
Space Ghost... I think I'm pregnant.
[Zorak and Moltar have occupied Space Ghost's apartments and are hiding under lampshades]
Hmmm... these aren't my lamps. These have feet.
[Guest Jon Benjamin, whose monitor is also hidden under a lampshade, chuckles]
I'd better go get a new apartment.
Moltar, take off your helmet... show me your true face.
Why?
Because, I'm intrigued.
No.
C'mon... I'll be your friend.
NO!
C'mon... I'll give you a dollar.
Okay...
[loud hissing sound]
GOOD GOD!
Did you just call me a monkey?
How much hair do you have, Space Ghost?
Oh, I don't know. Nine. Nine fat stalks!
Well, why, Space Ghost, if you weren't concerned about your own dome, why would you be so concerned and perhaps envious of those who have a full head of hair?
[pause]
Right.
Moltar, what's our depth?
20,000 leagues, sir.
Take her to twenty-one.
Twenty-one? But... why?
Because it's more fantastical.
[after viewing a commercial]
Finally, a product for me! I believe every word that man just said - because it's exactly what I wanted to hear.
[Space Ghost is threatening Zorak]
Whoa!
Whoa is what America's going to be saying when I spin his head off so fast it'll TRAVEL BACK IN TIME!
Blah blah blah blah.
Oh, you WANT the time-travel spinning head!
So, its all settled then. Now I have a contract drawn up for you to direct my movie. All you need to do is sign it, and then go away.
I'd be up for that, I'd sign a waiver.
Actually, its a little more binding than a waiver. It's more like a trap...
Wooh, Space Ghost, man! Crack a window, will ya!

[to Little Carl]
Shut! Shut! If you had a neck and I had hands, I would squeeze your brain, which is your body, right out the top of your head, which does not exist!
Let's break down these boxes so they store easier!
...That's boring!
You don't know from fun!
Sales will plummet! All because of this beef-witted Klingon!
Fetch daddy's blue fright wig! I must be handsome when I unleash my rage.
I learned that the best way to keep my parents off my back was to act like a grown-up, but I've been eight for fifty-six years.
they taste great on a sandwich. But when you're not eating a sandwich... they just sit there in the fridge... on a shelf... in a jar... labeled... mustard.

[talking to random kids]
... and that, kids, is how I saved Christmas. Now get back to work, you Fat Humps!
[singing the Twelve Days of Christmas]
[a horribly failed attempt at the Twelve Days of Christmas]
On the fifth day of Christmas, my true love gave to me...
Leonard Nimoy Sings!
Four quesadillas!
Three reruns of "What's Happening!"
Two plus eight is ten.
Hi, my name is Braaaak!
Enough! That was pitiful!
Welcome back, stupid viewers! You'll watch anything! Go ahead, change the channel. You'll be back!
[Conan is trying to get Space Ghost to admit that he was once alive]

[shouts]
Face it, space ghost!
No!
You're a spaceman that choked on a muffin!
That, Sir, is impossible, because I am allergic to muffins!
Oh, I'm sorry.
Yeah. You're thinking of "Muffin-Hunter". He's different.
Dennis, you've played a number of cops. Tell us how you came to be Robocop - the ultimate cop!
Well, listen, I had, uh, done a one-man show as Peter Weller called "Give 'Em Hell, Peter" for years off-Broadway...
Hang on, Peter. I'm way too angry to check out each off-Broadway production of "Robocop." I'll wait until it's on-Way!
Hey, have you heard my famous story?
[beat]
It starts in a couple of minutes.
[beat]
Beat. A long beat.

[laughing]
C'mon, what, do you need an edit point, Space Ghost?
The race war had begun.
[cartoon stock footage of missiles and robots appears]
Machines were building robot babies to replace other babies. Everyone knows what happened next.
[cartoon stock footage of surfing teens]
The end!
[laughs]
Written by Space Ghost! Robots by ILM... and Space Ghost!
[beat]
George Lucas by Space Ghost! House lights up, people leave theater. Trash... everywhere.
Bears are Crazy. They'll bite your head if you're wearing a steak on it.
Can you all come down to jail and get me out of jail? 'Cause guess where I am.
[pause]
JAIL.

[to Master Shake]
You need to chill out, and shut your lid cup, or else it'll be time to shake it up!
[pause]
And the drinks are on me.
[pause]
Cause I'm tired of milking this shake. And there's no... free refills this time.
[pause]
Excuse me Mam but the machine seems to be out of ice and, I just purchased this.
[longer pause]
Let me, let me rework this.
I saw a yard gnome once. It didn't scare me!
[Space Ghost follows ant that had bit him]
That's right, I'm following you. Just keep walking. For every 300 steps your little ant feet take I take only 1
That's it, run, run home. Take me to your family, for they will pay with my vengeance.
[Hidden door opens revealing giant ant 5 stories high]
Hey, your son just bit me, here. I wanna know what *you're* gonna do about it
[after pause giant ant screeches, chases Space Ghost]

[while running away]
Your son is a moron!
Show me the heinie!
Put your pants on.
Will you please keep your mind on the music?
I can't. It's mating season.
So, what's the big deal? Unless... Zorak, is it your first time?
Don't be ridiculous. I've mated, uh, lots of times.
Wait a minute. That can't be true!
And why not?
Because your head's still attached to your body.
Do we get a cool, invisible... Thing?
One of those belt things?
Seat belts? Those are for nerds! You boys aren't nerds, are ya? 'Cause this ain't the nerd taxi.
It's a free country!
Then you're still free to bite my ass, huh?
Yeah, bring your snake-ass over here and say that!
I just did and you didn't do anything!
I'll do whatever I want, it's a free country.
Now, you boys have teeth, don't ya?
What?
Look at that! Three boys with teeth. And hair... Beautiful girl hair...
What are you trying to say?
The little one looks like Claudia Schiffer.
You ever work with Lassie?
If by "working," you mean "bang up the ass," then yes... I have "worked" with her.
Ho ho! Heh... Ah-huh. Whe-heh.
[Turns to Zorak]
You hear what that guy said?

[Turns to Space Ghost]
... No.
[Turns back]

[Small giggle]
He said he "banged a dog up the you-know-what."

[Turns to Space Ghost]
... No...
[Looks at camera, then turns back]
Can you say "bang a dog up the ass" on T.V.?

[Turns to Space Ghost]
... No.
[Turns back]
Anything happen?
Um... I think some money came in.
Really? Hang on...
[Clears throat]
Ooookay... I, *too*, *banged a dog up the a... *
[Please stand by]
[Cheesy music playing]

[Space Ghost is in Moltar's director's lair]
Oh, come on, Moltar! It's not like it was *alive* or anything.
They can take you off the air for that kind of shit... Duh... Brrrph... I mean... stuff.
When did you become such a "Puritan?"
[Space Ghost teleports back to his desk]
Can we talk about some of the songs for a second?
Sure, we can talk about anything...
Yes...
...So long as "Sister Mary Moltar" isn't in the room!
You're really diggin' yourself a *deep hole*!

[On Moltar's monitor]
A hole that I will *bang my way ou... *
[Please stand by]
[Space Ghost is back with Moltar]
Calm down with this "religion!"
[Triumph starts making out with a sheep sock-puppet on the monitor]
You know, all this salty language... See, it ain't helpin' the found...

[Interrupting]
All I know, Moltar, is that I'm trying to create a "Retardo"-free society.
Well, you'll probably have the thanks of... all the retarded people watching.
They're not retarded, Moltar... "Retardo" is the name of the disease, ok? I named it... And tonight with this cute little dog's help...
[Triumph is on the monitor humping the sheep sock-puppet]
... We're going to find a cure.
I'm gonna go to the desk, now...
You go ahead and *try*. You see what you get.
[teleports to the desk]
Here I am now... At the desk.

[shouts]
You got lucky, Pal!
You try it *next time*! You see what you get!

Look, Moe. He's trying to tell us something. What is it, boy? There's trouble? Trouble at the farm? Farms have chickens. What is it, boy? Speak! Speak, boy! Just come out and say it! Out with it, man!
[Teller pulls a deck of cards out of his mouth one-by-one and throws them all over the place]
Ew... That's disgusting! Don't think you're not cleaning that up.
[Teller gets up and walks away]
Whoa! Looks like we're movin'!
We ARE moving, Moltar. To America!
And, uh, why are we doin' that?
Because all the successful superheroes live in America.
Okay...
It's really the only thing that keeps me from being the next Superman.
Are you faster than a speeding bullet?
Well... no, but...
Are you able to leap tall buildings with...
Moltar, that's not the point.
